verses.kjv: At that time Abijah the son of Jeroboam fell sick.
verses.web: At that time Abijah the son of Jeroboam became sick.
verses.ct: Around that time, Jeroboam's son Abijah became sick.

verses.kjv: And Jeroboam said to his wife, Arise, I pray thee, and disguise thyself, that thou be not known to be the wife of Jeroboam; and get thee to Shiloh: behold, there is Ahijah the prophet, which told me that I should be king over this people.
verses.web: Jeroboam said to his wife, “Please get up and disguise yourself, so that you won’t be recognized as Jeroboam’s wife. Go to Shiloh. Behold, Ahijah the prophet is there, who said that I would be king over this people.
verses.ct: Jeroboam told his wife, "Get up and disguise yourself so no one will recognize you as my wife. Then go to Shiloh — that's where the prophet Ahijah lives, the one who told me I would become king over this people."

verses.kjv: And take with thee ten loaves, and cracknels, and a cruse of honey, and go to him: he shall tell thee what shall become of the child.
verses.web: Take with you ten loaves of bread, some cakes, and a jar of honey, and go to him. He will tell you what will become of the child.”
verses.ct: "Take 10 loaves of bread, some cakes, and a jar of honey with you. Go to him, and he'll tell you what will happen to our son."

verses.kjv: And Jeroboam’s wife did so, and arose, and went to Shiloh, and came to the house of Ahijah. But Ahijah could not see; for his eyes were set by reason of his age.
verses.web: Jeroboam’s wife did so, and arose, and went to Shiloh, and came to Ahijah’s house. Now Ahijah could not see; for his eyes were set by reason of his age.
verses.ct: Jeroboam's wife did as he said. She got up and traveled to Shiloh, arriving at Ahijah's house. By this time, Ahijah had gone blind — his eyes had failed because of his old age.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Ahijah, Behold, the wife of Jeroboam cometh to ask a thing of thee for her son; for he is sick: thus and thus shalt thou say unto her: for it shall be, when she cometh in, that she shall feign herself to be another woman.
verses.web: LORD said to Ahijah, “Behold, Jeroboam’s wife is coming to inquire of you concerning her son; for he is sick. Tell her such and such; for it will be, when she comes in, that she will pretend to be another woman.”
verses.ct: But the LORD told Ahijah, "Jeroboam's wife is on her way to ask you about her son, who is sick. When she arrives, she'll pretend to be someone else. Here is what I want you to tell her."

verses.kjv: And it was so, when Ahijah heard the sound of her feet, as she came in at the door, that he said, Come in, thou wife of Jeroboam; why feignest thou thyself to be another? for I am sent to thee with heavy tidings.
verses.web: So when Ahijah heard the sound of her feet as she came in at the door, he said, “Come in, Jeroboam’s wife! Why do you pretend to be another? For I am sent to you with heavy news.
verses.ct: So when Ahijah heard her footsteps at the door, he called out, "Come in, wife of Jeroboam! Why are you pretending to be someone else? I've been given a hard message for you."

verses.kjv: Go, tell Jeroboam, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Forasmuch as I exalted thee from among the people, and made thee prince over my people Israel,
verses.web: Go, tell Jeroboam, ‘LORD, the God of Israel, says: “Because I exalted you from among the people, and made you prince over my people Israel,
verses.ct: "Go back and tell Jeroboam that this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'I lifted you up from among the common people and made you ruler over my people Israel.

verses.kjv: And rent the kingdom away from the house of David, and gave it thee: and yet thou hast not been as my servant David, who kept my commandments, and who followed me with all his heart, to do that only which was right in mine eyes;
verses.web: and tore the kingdom away from David’s house, and gave it you; and yet you have not been as my servant David, who kept my commandments, and who followed me with all his heart, to do that only which was right in my eyes,
verses.ct: I tore the kingdom away from David's family and gave it to you. But you haven't been like my servant David, who obeyed my commands and followed me with his whole heart, doing only what I considered right.

verses.kjv: But hast done evil above all that were before thee: for thou hast gone and made thee other gods, and molten images, to provoke me to anger, and hast cast me behind thy back:
verses.web: but have done evil above all who were before you, and have gone and made for yourself other gods, molten images, to provoke me to anger, and have cast me behind your back;
verses.ct: Instead, you've done more evil than anyone who came before you. You made other gods for yourself — metal idols — to provoke my anger. You've thrown me aside like I'm nothing.

verses.kjv: Therefore, behold, I will bring evil upon the house of Jeroboam, and will cut off from Jeroboam him that pisseth against the wall, and him that is shut up and left in Israel, and will take away the remnant of the house of Jeroboam, as a man taketh away dung, till it be all gone.
verses.web: therefore, behold, I will bring evil on the house of Jeroboam, and will cut off from Jeroboam everyone who urinates on a wall, he who is shut up and he who is left at large in Israel, and will utterly sweep away the house of Jeroboam, as a man sweeps away dung, until it is all gone.
verses.ct: Because of this, I'm going to bring disaster on your family. I will destroy every male in Jeroboam's line, whether slave or free in Israel. I will sweep away your entire household the way someone shovels dung until none is left.

verses.kjv: Him that dieth of Jeroboam in the city shall the dogs eat; and him that dieth in the field shall the fowls of the air eat: for the LORD hath spoken it.
verses.web: The dogs will eat he who belongs to Jeroboam who dies in the city; and the birds of the sky will eat he who dies in the field: for LORD has spoken it.” ’
verses.ct: Anyone from your family who dies in the city will be eaten by dogs, and anyone who dies in the open country will be eaten by birds. The LORD has spoken.'"

verses.kjv: Arise thou therefore, get thee to thine own house: and when thy feet enter into the city, the child shall die.
verses.web: Arise therefore, and go to your house. When your feet enter into the city, the child will die.
verses.ct: "Now get up and go home. The moment your feet step into the city, your child will die.

verses.kjv: And all Israel shall mourn for him, and bury him: for he only of Jeroboam shall come to the grave, because in him there is found some good thing toward the LORD God of Israel in the house of Jeroboam.
verses.web: All Israel will mourn for him and bury him; for he only of Jeroboam will come to the grave, because in him there is found some good thing toward LORD, the God of Israel, in the house of Jeroboam.
verses.ct: All of Israel will mourn for him and bury him. He's the only one in Jeroboam's family who will receive a proper burial, because he's the only one in whom the LORD, the God of Israel, found anything good.

verses.kjv: Moreover the LORD shall raise him up a king over Israel, who shall cut off the house of Jeroboam that day: but what? even now.
verses.web: Moreover LORD will raise up a king for himself over Israel, who will cut off the house of Jeroboam. This is the day! What? Even now.
verses.ct: The LORD will raise up a king over Israel who will wipe out Jeroboam's entire family. And that day is coming — in fact, it's already here.

verses.kjv: For the LORD shall smite Israel, as a reed is shaken in the water, and he shall root up Israel out of this good land, which he gave to their fathers, and shall scatter them beyond the river, because they have made their groves, provoking the LORD to anger.
verses.web: For LORD will strike Israel, as a reed is shaken in the water; and he will root up Israel out of this good land which he gave to their fathers, and will scatter them beyond the River, because they have made their Asherah poles, provoking LORD to anger.
verses.ct: The LORD will strike Israel so that it sways like a reed tossed in the water. He will uproot Israel from this good land he gave to their ancestors and scatter them beyond the Euphrates River, because they set up their Asherah poles and provoked the LORD to anger.

verses.kjv: And he shall give Israel up because of the sins of Jeroboam, who did sin, and who made Israel to sin.
verses.web: He will give Israel up because of the sins of Jeroboam, which he has sinned, and with which he has made Israel to sin.”
verses.ct: He will abandon Israel because of the sins Jeroboam committed — sins that led all of Israel to sin along with him."

verses.kjv: And Jeroboam’s wife arose, and departed, and came to Tirzah: and when she came to the threshold of the door, the child died;
verses.web: Jeroboam’s wife arose and departed, and came to Tirzah. As she came to the threshold of the house, the child died.
verses.ct: Jeroboam's wife got up and left, traveling back to Tirzah. The moment she stepped across the threshold of her house, the child died.

verses.kjv: And they buried him; and all Israel mourned for him, according to the word of the LORD, which he spake by the hand of his servant Ahijah the prophet.
verses.web: All Israel buried him and mourned for him, according to LORD’s word, which he spoke by his servant Ahijah the prophet.
verses.ct: They buried him, and all of Israel mourned for him, just as the LORD had said through his servant the prophet Ahijah.

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he warred, and how he reigned, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
verses.web: The rest of the acts of Jeroboam, how he fought, and how he reigned, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.
verses.ct: Everything else about Jeroboam's reign — his wars and how he ruled — is recorded in the official history of Israel's kings.

verses.kjv: And the days which Jeroboam reigned were two and twenty years: and he slept with his fathers, and Nadab his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: The days which Jeroboam reigned were twenty two years, then he slept with his fathers, and Nadab his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Jeroboam reigned for 22 years. Then he died, and his son Nadab became king after him.

verses.kjv: And Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty and one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the LORD did choose out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there. And his mother’s name was Naamah an Ammonitess.
verses.web: Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was forty-one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which LORD had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there. His mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonitess.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Solomon's son Rehoboam was ruling in Judah. He was 41 years old when he became king, and he reigned for 17 years in Jerusalem — the city the LORD had chosen from all the tribes of Israel as the place for his name. His mother was Naamah, an Ammonitess.

verses.kjv: And Judah did evil in the sight of the LORD, and they provoked him to jealousy with their sins which they had committed, above all that their fathers had done.
verses.web: Judah did that which was evil in LORD’s sight, and they provoked him to jealousy with their sins which they committed, above all that their fathers had done.
verses.ct: The LORD saw that Judah was evil. Their sins stirred up his jealousy even more than anything their ancestors had done.

verses.kjv: For they also built them high places, and images, and groves, on every high hill, and under every green tree.
verses.web: For they also built for themselves high places, sacred pillars, and Asherah poles on every high hill and under every green tree.
verses.ct: They built pagan shrines, sacred pillars, and Asherah poles on every high hill and under every green tree.

verses.kjv: And there were also sodomites in the land: and they did according to all the abominations of the nations which the LORD cast out before the children of Israel.
verses.web: There were also sodomites in the land. They did according to all the abominations of the nations which LORD drove out before the children of Israel.
verses.ct: There were even male shrine prostitutes throughout the land. The people practiced all the disgusting things the nations had done — the very nations the LORD had driven out to make room for Israel.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the fifth year of king Rehoboam, that Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem:
verses.web: In the fifth year of king Rehoboam, Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem,
verses.ct: In the 5th year of King Rehoboam's reign, King Shishak of Egypt attacked Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he took away the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king’s house; he even took away all: and he took away all the shields of gold which Solomon had made.
verses.web: and he took away the treasures of LORD’s house, and the treasures of the king’s house. He even took away all of it, including all the gold shields which Solomon had made.
verses.ct: He carried off the treasures from the LORD's temple and the royal palace — he took everything, including all the gold shields Solomon had made.

verses.kjv: And king Rehoboam made in their stead brasen shields, and committed them unto the hands of the chief of the guard, which kept the door of the king’s house.
verses.web: King Rehoboam made shields of bronze in their place, and committed them to the hands of the captains of the guard, who kept the door of the king’s house.
verses.ct: King Rehoboam replaced them with bronze shields and put them in the care of the captains of the royal guard who protected the entrance to the palace.

verses.kjv: And it was so, when the king went into the house of the LORD, that the guard bare them, and brought them back into the guard chamber.
verses.web: It was so, that as often as the king went into LORD’s house, the guard bore them, and brought them back into the guard room.
verses.ct: Whenever the king went to the LORD's temple, the guards would carry the shields and then return them to the guardroom afterward.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Rehoboam, and all that he did, aren’t they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: Everything else about Rehoboam's reign and all that he did is recorded in the official history of Judah's kings.

verses.kjv: And there was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam all their days.
verses.web: There was war between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
verses.ct: Rehoboam and Jeroboam were at war with each other the entire time they both reigned.

verses.kjv: And Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David. And his mother’s name was Naamah an Ammonitess. And Abijam his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in David’s city. His mother’s name was Naamah the Ammonitess. Abijam his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: Rehoboam died and was buried with his ancestors in the city of David. His mother was Naamah, an Ammonitess. His son Abijam became king after him.
